relationships.evidence: Harry missed his best friends, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger.
Harry missed his best friends, Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger.
But I'm also — I don't know if anyone ever told you — I'm your godfather.

relationships.description: Sirius seeks revenge on Peter for betraying the Potters.
relationships.evidence: I meant to [kill him], but little Peter got the better of me... not this time, though!

relationships.description: Peter was a spy for Voldemort.
relationships.evidence: You'd been passing information to him for a year before Lily and James died! You were his spy!

relationships.description: Lupin teaches Harry the Patronus Charm.
relationships.evidence: The spell I am going to try and teach you is highly advanced magic, Harry... It is called the Patronus Charm.

relationships.description: Harry kills the Basilisk with the Sword of Gryffindor.
relationships.evidence: Harry threw his whole weight behind the sword and drove it to the hilt into the roof of the serpent's mouth.

relationships.description: Harry destroys the diary with a basilisk fang.
relationships.evidence: Harry seized the basilisk fang on the floor next to him and plunged it straight into the heart of the book.

relationships.description: Ginny was possessed by the diary.
relationships.evidence: Ginny Weasley opened the Chamber of Secrets... I grew stronger and stronger on a diet of her deepest fears.

relationships.description: Lupin is one of the creators (Moony).
relationships.evidence: I helped write it. I'm Moony — that was my friends' nickname for me at school.

relationships.description: Harry receives the Firebolt as a gift.
relationships.evidence: Harry ripped the parcel open and gasped as a magnificent, gleaming broomstick rolled out onto his bedspread.

relationships.description: Hermione uses the Time-Turner to attend classes and save Sirius.
relationships.evidence: It's called a Time-Turner... I've been using it all year to get to all my lessons.

relationships.description: Harry casts a corporeal Patronus to save Sirius.
relationships.evidence: And out of the end of his wand burst, not a shapeless cloud of mist, but a blinding, dazzling, silver animal.

relationships.description: Snape brews the Wolfsbane Potion for Lupin.
relationships.evidence: Professor Snape has very kindly concocted a potion for me.

schema_proposals.name: owns_creature
schema_proposals.description: Indicates ownership or companionship between a character and a creature (e.g., Harry and Hedwig, Ron and Scabbers).

schema_proposals.name: Animagus
schema_proposals.description: A specific type of magical ability or form where a character transforms into an animal. Currently handled via attributes, but significant enough for a type or specific relationship.
